Package C2G8_Project.MonitorSystem

Class MonitorController

java.lang.Object
C2G8_Project.MonitorSystem.MonitorController
All Implemented Interfaces:
DispatchConsumer
public class MonitorController extends Object implements DispatchConsumer
The main controller used to give the main window functionality and also responsible for handling dispatcher updates to the system state
Author:
Jayson Mendoza

  • Method Details

    • assignClientID

      protected static int assignClientID()
      Assigns the client ID so it is unique. There may be more than one MonitorSystem running
      Returns:

    • instance

      public static MonitorController instance() throws SocketException
      Implements a singleton so only one Monitor Controller exists. This will return the instance that exists or create a new one if none exists.
      Returns:
      Monitor Controller instance
      Throws:
      SocketException

    • shutdown

      public void shutdown()
      Shuts down Monitor System

    • getMainScene

    • receiveDispatch

      public void receiveDispatch(String topic, String data)
      Handles updates from subscribed messages to dipatcher. This is generally new state updates from the scheduler.
      Specified by:
      receiveDispatch in interface DispatchConsumer
      Parameters:
      topic - The topic under which the data was received
      data - The data contained within the message in JSON format

    • getSubscriberNameIdentifier

      public String getSubscriberNameIdentifier()
      Description copied from interface: DispatchConsumer
      This is the name that will be used to identify this DispatchConsumer within the Dispatchers logs
      Specified by:
      getSubscriberNameIdentifier in interface DispatchConsumer
      Returns:
      The string name that will be used to represent this dispatch consmer in logs
